original: Björnberg, Joen Gustaf Fredrik, överläkare o. sjukhuschef, Lillhagen, f. 5/2/97 i Gbg av sjökapt. Jacob Fredrik B. o. Elin Maria Aqvist. G. 32 m. Marianne Rotsman. Barn: Ulf f. 33, Gunilla 38, Sten 39, Kjell 42. — Stud:-ex. i Gbg 15, med. kand. i Upps. 18 o. med. lic. där 24. E. läk. v. Upps. hosp. o. asyl 23 o. 24, e. o. hosp :läk, av 2. kl. v, Västerviks hosp. 24-27, e, läk. v. Västerviks las. fyra mån., hosp :läk. av 2. kl. v. Lunds hosp. 27- 30, läk. o. sjukhxhef v. S:t Olofs sjukh. 31-33, överläk. av 3. kl. v. Ul^ leråkers sjukh. 34-35, förordn. s. över-läk. av 2. kl. o. sjukh :chef v. Gådeå sjukh. o. läk. v. centr :fäng. i Härnösand 32-35, överläk. o. sjukh :chef v. S:t Jörgens sjukh. sed. 36. RNO.
translated: Björnberg, Joen Gustaf Fredrik, senior physician and hospital director, Lillhagen, born on February 5, 1897 in Gothenburg to sea captain Jacob Fredrik B. and Elin Maria Aqvist. Married in 1932 to Marianne Rotsman. Children: Ulf, born in 1933, Gunilla in 1938, Sten in 1939, and Kjell in 1942. Completed high school in Gothenburg in 1915, became a medical candidate in Uppsala in 1918 and earned a medical license there in 1924. Worked as a junior physician at Uppsala hospital and asylum in 1923 and 1924, assistant physician of the 2nd class at Västervik hospital from 1924 to 1927, junior physician at Västervik hospital for four months, assistant physician of the 2nd class at Lund hospital from 1927 to 1930, physician and hospital director at St. Olaf's hospital from 1931 to 1933, senior physician of the 3rd class at Ulleråker hospital from 1934 to 1935, appointed as senior physician of the 2nd class and hospital director at Gådeå hospital and physician at the central prison in Härnösand from 1932 to 1935, and became senior physician and hospital director at St. Jörgen's hospital from 1936. Awarded RNO.
